question: Which of the following has become the India's first city to have a common mobility card for rides on public buses and the metro?
explanation: Arvind Kejriwal, the chief minister of Delhi, has launched a common mobility card scheme to aid seamless travel between the cityâ€™s bus transport and the Metro system on January 8, 2018. With this, Delhi has become the India\'s first city to have a common mobility card, which can at present be used on 200 DTC and 50 cluster buses plying on different routes, apart from metro trains. The card, which will function like a debit card, will be operational in all DTC and cluster buses from April. The city has around 3,900 DTC and over 1,600 cluster buses.
